alert.note: Alert for Coastal Volusia; Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 14 at 3:46AM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Fog Beginning to Spread into Lake and Volusia Counties... At 345 AM, satellite imagery and surface observations show a large area of fog, just ahead of a cold front, spreading southeast into northern Lake and northwestern Volusia Counties. Visibilities have dropped below one mile in the fog, and were as low as one quarter to one half mile in some locations. The fog is expected to spread south to the I-4 corridor through sunrise, then dissipate between 8 and 9 AM. Motorists who will be driving in areas near and northwest of I-4 early this morning should prepare for the likelihood of encountering locally dense fog on their commute. Reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. Should dense fog with visibilities of 1/4 mile or less become widespread this morning, then a Dense Fog Advisory will be issued.
